website_summaries.verdict: The Nexus 6 is a powerful plus-sized Android handset, though the slimmer Samsung Galaxy Note 4 delivers superior overall performance and native productivity features.
pros: The Google Nexus 6 has a razor-sharp and expansive display, a powerful Snapdragon 805 processor, the Android Lollipop OS and an OIS-equipped camera that takes great photos
cons: Broad and bulky, the Nexus may be too big -- in size and price -- for some users

customer_reviews.title: Risky purchase. Great phone if yours works.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it but the data became unresponsive after 2 months of use. Worked fine before...no drops, been in wallet case since the day I bought it. I tested my sim card in other phones and it works fine. Cellular calls and texts work, but no data. Now I'm stuck with s $275 phone that worked for 10 weeks. Went to Motorola website based on the Amazon listing for warranty but it wouldn't work. ***UPDATE: Reset the phone and switched the cellular setting and it's working again. Very happy because I like the phone, so I changed my rating back to 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C. Brunner

customer_reviews.title: A King among kings.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is a little wider in ratio than 99% of phones. Similar to the original Samsung Note 1, which was also less 'Bar' like. I prefer the format as less narrow and easier to read. The phone is a very pleasant experience. Don't care that is will only go to Android 7. The differences are so minute in upgrades, I think it's oversold. Visual clarity and sound quality all shine, and this is the best phone I have used that's over 5.5". Sitting next to my previous Moto 5" phone, it's amazing that both phones physically are about the same, but the Nexus 6 has more screen real estate.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great buy in 2017
customer_reviews.text: The reason this phone stilll sells for $330 is because it's worth it. Much more durable than the 6p, and with a better featureset, this phone received none of the advertisement of the inferior Huawei Nexus. One of the best optimized snapdragon 808 phones, a processor much superior to the 810, this thing still outpaces my axon 7, which uses an 820, in day to day tasks. Absolutely great in the hand, everything is glass or anodized metal, and features a very high water resistance rating. Call quality equally fantastic, and if you're on Tmobile, this thing does VOLTE and WIFI calling as of, at latest, Jan 2017. If you can wrap your hand around this thing, get it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lemon camera?
customer_reviews.text: The rear camera is so choppy it's unusable for both video and pictures. The phone is so slow I want to throw it at times. I've had it for two years and after this experience, I won't be buying another Motorola phone. The sound is good and when it works, it really works. No micro SD card slot, battery isn't removable (well, it isn't, unless you've got know-how). Had to replace the battery after a year. Just garbage. I had high expectations for a Motorola product since I'm a fan of their two-way radios.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A bit large - but built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these on sale for 199 each. Both phones lasted us 3 years each were well worth the value. Now for the cons: I missed that this did not have extensible sd card. But made up for it by using cloud storage. The massive size was a bit cumbersome to hold on to. But again this was made up for by the larger screen to watch videos and movies with. This was especially worth it when travelling. Overall I was happy I got these for the price they were. at full price i might rethink it.
customer_reviews.author: AiM

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant smartphone with amazing screen display
customer_reviews.text: Perfect smartphone. Bit large for first time users but once you get used to it, you can't look back. The QHD screen is a treat to the eyes. The icons and text look amazingly clear. Amoled screen makes it even better. The camera quality is great as well. The body of phone is very appealing, with metal edges. I bought two of them. One white 64gb and the 32gb blue. The new updated price of Nexus 6 is more apt. I bought the Nexus 6 64gb at the original price of 699$ which i now believe was overpriced for it. Nexus always has an advantage of getting first updates from Google, that is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: P. Singh

customer_reviews.title: Random Reboots
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this phone. The battery life was good the screen was nice the phone was big. But that's to be expected when buying this type of smart phone. The problem was with it randomly rebooting all day long. I tried clearing the cache partitions and factory reset running in safe mode but it kept doing it. All google could say was contact the manafacturer of the phone we cannot help any further because it was purchased from Amazon. WTF kind of answers is that it's brand new not a refurb not used brand new. So it was returned and thats the end of that story. Sorry Nexus I really wanted to like you.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Nelson

customer_reviews.title: battery is not even good enough to used 1day
customer_reviews.text: Terrible terrible terrible let say this 1 more time terrible battery life even with all the things turn off ur phone battery dieds even when the screen off u will never get a full day the most u will get if u actually used the phone is 4 to 5 hours thats a promise
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be a huge upgrade coming from the galaxy s4 from at&tt considering that this has a faster processor, more ram and none of the Samsung/att bloatware. Sadly, it's only slightly faster. The front facing stereo speakers are much better than the rear facing single speaker that I'm used to except that they are kinda quiet. Also the screen is very easily broken. I have never broken a screen before. I dropped this phone from less than 2 feet above the ground and it shattered. I've dropped my past Samsungs several times with barely a scratch. I will definitely be going back to Samsung next time.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Chun

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get into project fi
customer_reviews.text: Whoo! At the price I paid this thing was a steal, especially compared to what google is charging for phones. Works perfectly on project fi. But it's big. At first I thought I wouldn't like it because it's so big, but after about a week it seems perfectly normal. And I can actually read the text on it! (I'm 59 so that is a BIG deal).
customer_reviews.author: Empire Builder

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for now.
customer_reviews.text: After to many replasement i think i gat the perfect one Motorola Nexus 6 64GB GSM Unlocked from Edge Cellular, fast shipping. Doesn't have sound equilazer but have stereo sound, no complain, I hope continue as descripted or is to soon. Looks decent phone . I have Samsung, Sony Xperia and this is my 4th in my collection, I do not like global or international version, no 4g/LTE band or speed
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: By far the best phone I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The screen is huge and bright, the battery lasts more than long enough, the stereo speakers can be heard clearly across a table in a crowded restaurant. I cannot say enough good things about this phone. It will be a sad day when it breaks and needs to be replaced. Minor complaints: - Battery is not replaceable. - No MicroSD slot. - The back is very slick and therefore requires the use of a case. I would definitely buy this phone again. I have not seen another comparable 6" phone, certainly not at this price.
customer_reviews.author: CalifGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, but easy to break.
customer_reviews.text: I love the specs on this phone, and it's gorgeous. However, buyer beware, this phone is completely breakable. My husband had one in a rugged case, not an otter box type case, but one with padded edging, and with less than a 3 foot drop on the bedroom floor, the glass screen shattered completely. If you are even remotely clumsy with your phone at all, consider buying an otterbox style case for this phone, as it will break your heart to destroy it, since it's largely no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: GirlfriendMD

customer_reviews.title: it is a great phone. I was worried that the size would ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it is a great phone. I was worried that the size would be uncomfortable when making phone calls but that is not the case. (I have average size hands for a male) I have not used the camera much so I can't speak to that. Sound quality is good when making phone calls, browsing speed is very good, the front facing speakers are great for a phone (why don't all phones have that) and the screen is very good. The only real complaint I have is the placement of the physical keys to unlock the screen and control the sound. I find myself occasionally hitting those keys on accident.
customer_reviews.author: gregory m white

customer_reviews.title: i'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: this is my first time purchasing a used cell phone and so far so good excepting for the overheating which i guess is a common issue for this phone. very fast processor though. it looks and feels nice. definitely not a one-handed phone unless you have huge hands. got a good deal at amazon warehouse for $203. i noticed the battery drains faster than my old LG G2 probably coz of the bigger screen. i'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: John Bustos

customer_reviews.title: Discounted cost removes any roadblocks of hesitation
customer_reviews.text: After the $300 price reduction, the Nexus 6 became a deal impossible to refuse. After my Asus Zenfone 2 stopped identifying touch input without having been dropped a single time spanning months, I was absolutely heart broken, forced to give up the Intel based phone @ 5.5" I had grown extremely fond of. The Nexus 6, through and through, however, is a better device across the board. Brighter screen, higher pixel density, more slender dimensions, much much better sound, improved photographic clarity. At this cost, the device is unmatched!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this 3 years ago in "Condition: New", received refurbished item.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 3 years ago in "Condition: New" and I received a refurbished item. The item worked well enough but eventually I needed to repair the charging port and when I opened up the phone I found missing screws, missing rubber covers (including the one for the main microphone which I'm guessing also helps redirect sound and make incoming voices sound right ~_~), and the processor for the digitizer still had the plastic cover on the back...meaning it wasn't even sunk to the heat sink like it should be. We specifically paid more for "brand new phones" so that we wouldn't have to deal with issues or poor craftsmanship. So much for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motorola does it again (Switched from Moto once, and got the Samdung -- Yes dung, because it was Sh!t)
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this device. I received exactly what i expected, as advertised, and my device is fully functional and working without issue on Verizon. Anyone looking to get this device from Amazon should be happy with their purchase. If you're on VZW, contact customer service and request the nano sim card (it is free) which is required for the network, and go about the normal activation process. Just for reference, mine was purchased in January of 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Droid User

customer_reviews.title: The extra screen real estate makes the phone useful as an every day replacement for basic tasks you ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for two months now, well beyond the initial shock to its size. No doubt it's a massive phone, but I'm not sure I could get a smaller one after getting used to this now. The extra screen real estate makes the phone useful as an every day replacement for basic tasks you used to do on a computer. Riding the train every day while reading news, watching videos and listening to music and I am still able to get through more than 1 day on a single charge. The turbo charging is also helpful as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great phone.
customer_reviews.text: Best phone I've had. OK, only had three smartphones, but with T-Mobile and no contract, I wanted a big phone. I always joke this phone can take other phones and really is my tablet. Really I don't see the complaints on size. Only had some glitches in the camera which were weird, streak of green on a picture, white haze on another. No external SD card sucks. But that is why I went with the 64 GB unit. Barely erased many videos or photos. Still a ton of space. All phones should be this big or close and carry 64 gb. Also, decent speed. One year has passed, probably got another year left but I am happy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This was a very nice phone when purchased on sale at the end of ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a very nice phone when purchased on sale at the end of 2015. After 2 1/2 years of use, this phone has performed well, however, it seems now to get bogged down and run slowly, and I would no longer give it a very high rating. I got a Pixel 2, meanwhile, which is really zippy by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during black friday to replace my aging S4. Everything about it is better than the S4 except video recording. The Nexus 6 has a horrible video camera. It cannot focus on moving objects. I like to take videos for instagram and this phone is absolute trash when it comes to videos. It constantly tries to focus and this leads to blurry videos. Besides the video problem, the phone is great. Longer battery life than the S4 and also much faster.
customer_reviews.author: ClownPrince

customer_reviews.title: Bought it at $350. Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pro 1. Stock Android (if you like that). 2. screen looks stunning. 3. very well built. 4. Nexus phones are easily rooted. Con 1. Screen has a pinkish shade when brightness is turned down. 2. The battery life of this phone is sub-par. It has a 3000ish Mah battery, but I usually get only 3 hours of screen time from it. 3. low light pictures and videos are not good. There are alot of statics.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome phone. Have had it for about a month ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome phone. Have had it for about a month now and I am totally impressed. My other phone was a Galaxy note 2, which was good or still is but the nexus is far better. No more tons of bloatware running in the background. The Nexus 6 runs very smooth no problems what so ever. Activated on the Verizon network and everything is working great. If you are thinking about this phone get it you will not be disappointed. Great sound, super display, simple to use Just do it, and get the Nexus 6
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Best Amazon Deal 2015!
customer_reviews.text: what a Bargain! Love this phone. Upon initial start, you'll experience several updates so wait until it's completed done (Adroid 6.0 Marshmallow) before customizing phone to your needs. Beautiful screen, nice big juicy screen that reminds me of my galaxy note 2. Battery life is good, but it won't last a full day with average use or even minimal use in my case b/c i have on location and bluetooth most of the time. Phone is fast! no sluggish experience. $299 with prime was the best deal one can get for such a device. if you're in need of a phone or give gifts, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy Wuzzy

customer_reviews.title: HD Voice and voLTE worked flawlessly on Verizon but not AT&T.
customer_reviews.text: Great pure android phone for the current price. I used it on AT&T first and they refused to activate HD voice (voLTE) option because it was not ATT branded. Changed carrier to Verizon for other reasons, and I had the option to activate any features it has from my account. Works flawlessly on Verizon with HD Voice option and full LTE data speed. Battery is great with Android 6.0.1 and it lasts for 2 days with normal use.
customer_reviews.author: R-Dash

customer_reviews.title: do not buy it you a play lot of mobile game.if you want real Warranty buy only amzon
customer_reviews.text: so i play a lot mobile game my phone so get really hot a lot more most normal person will.the nexus back case become unglued and slowly separating and this seem issuer a lot early make unit .so if you buy 3 party there are not authorized resale of it you do not get the Warranty by Motorola.i get it off Amazon Seller - BREED there only have warranty of 30 days.so not i only get 9 months heavy use and need shop for new phone
customer_reviews.author: ka fai wong

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 18 months and still am not looking for a new phone.
customer_reviews.text: This baby does everything I need it to. It even runs a full version of Kali Linux 2.0 and accepts my Alfa AWUS036NEH adapter for Wifi pentesting. Do yourself a favor and get the 64 gb version. I paid $400 for mine back in October 2015 and thought that was a hell of a deal. I'll continue to use this bad boy for at least another 6 months. Normally I change phones 3 or 4x a year. This is a new record for me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Phone came on time as promised, and appeared to be in good condition. However, I have had it a week now and after 4 days the phone stopped charging. I've tried several different cables, including ones that work on my wife's android phone, and none will charge this phone. I've left it charging all night the last 3 nights and in the morning it is at 7% or less. The phone battery actually goes down while it's charged and you're using it. I'm very frustrated and upset. This seller had great reviews so I trusted them and purchased the phone, but beware of buying phones that appear to be in good working order when in all reality they are faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Ritter

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't have as many cool extra features that HTC has
customer_reviews.text: It works the same as my previous HTC One, I really don't see why I had to spend three times the amount of money when Nexus 6 satisfies all my cellphone needs. Pro: everything works perfectly, no lag, nothing breaks after 6 months of use. Extra pro: android updates come quicker. Con: it doesn't have as many cool extra features that HTC has, but it's not like it was a necessity in the first place. Con: the camera isn't as good as HTC, sometimes it's blurry, color contrast is bad, or quality is poor. It does get hot when it's charging or used for 2 hours straight, but nothing bad has happened so far.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: the DIY video makes it look real easy, don't be fooled
customer_reviews.text: the only thing wrong with this phone is the sealed in battery, i don't advise opening this phone yourself when the battery finally goes or needs to be unplugged and plugged back in, you'll need 3 hands, the DIY video makes it look real easy, don't be fooled, its not. other wise this phone is awesome, big screen, clarity, easy to use all functions, will very likely get another even if it is discontinued from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good phone but beware of issues with camera
customer_reviews.text: The phone was great and everything, very powerful and sturdy, however it came with a camera issue that did not allow any application to connect to the camera. I tried factory resetting the phone many times, cleaning the cache of the camera app and even booting on safe mode and nothing helped. I ended up contacting Motorola to get it either replaced or fixed. I sent back more than a week ago and still no email or anything for Motorola about it. This has been a really frustating experience and that issue seemed to be in a lot of devices. If you do some research online about the issue you will find many like me.
customer_reviews.author: Angel D. Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone! I feel like it's an appropriate upgrade and a great as a first time phablet if you previously used a Nexus 5 like I have. Much more powerful, crispy screen and improved hardware. People who are saying this is a large phone. It is. But I also believe people are overreacting. Yes it's big, but if you're looking at this phone in the first place you aren't concerned about that, it's an overall great android experience. I also get lots of complements on this phone too, mostly from apple and samsung users! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Said Fathy

customer_reviews.title: Dependability
customer_reviews.text: Bought it brand new unlocked 2 years ago. Still working great as usual. Don't by refurbished. When ever there was Android update it will glitch so I would wait few days before I let the update take effect on my phone so Android program can get rid of any issue before it hits my phone. Don't use cheap charger it will screw up your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Narami.D

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I was able to give my wife my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I was able to give my wife my Nexus 5 so we could change carriers and get better service. It was easy to unlock the bootloader and load a custom ROM. My only negative is the design for the placement of the power and volume. I wish they were in a different position since they get mostly covered by my car cradle.
customer_reviews.author: C A

customer_reviews.title: Motorola does it again
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for one week and it has met all my expectations. Great processing speed and can multitask very well. It's very user friendly and intuitive. Have this connected to Google Project Fi (utilizes tmobile, sprint, or wifi whichever is strongest) and my monthly bills are estimated to be between $25-35 total for each month. The savings on the phone bill alone will cover the cost of this phone in a year when compared to being on a major network.
customer_reviews.author: UteFan87

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding me? BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.text: Came in perfect condition, and the only thing not perfect was the box, so who cares? I get the pure Android experience without all the phone brand garbage apps (Android 6 Marshmallow by the way), and I got on Project Fi, which is Google's own phone service that is MUCH less expensive than any other service. Hardware wise, this phone is no slouch either, with a QHD screen (like a 4K tv), stereo speakers, an elegant design, and a 13 GB image sensor that allows you to take incredibly good photos AND 4K video?!? What's not to love about this?
customer_reviews.author: R. Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: Confirmed Verizon User!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this phone, I went to my local Verizon store. I asked them to bring out a new Nexus 6 and I verified a XT1103 model is the one they sell. I asked the associate if I purchased the phone on Amazon if they would activate it. The associate confirmed they would. I then purchased the phone on Amazon directly. When I took the phone to Verizon they activated it seamlessly. My online account for Verizon Wireless shows my device as "Nexus 6 non-vzw". Verizon users follow my format and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely incredible. Brilliant screen, great battery life, and blazing fast performance. I have huge hands and this is the first phone I've found that doesn't feel like a toy. The price is perfect for this, especially considering that it's unlocked. I have it working on Verizon no problem. Just moved my old SIM from my HTC One M8 into this and gave Verizon a quick call to give them the new numbers. Had it up and running in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: so I was very happy to get this white one for $349
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a new cell phone, but did not want to pay a ton for one of the flagship devices. T-Mobile was selling the midnight blue version for $600+ dollars, so I was very happy to get this white one for $349. I thought I would like the "bare bones" Android experience a lot more than I do, and I miss a lot of the functions from my previous Samsung Galaxy S4. It's a decent phone for the price, but I am glad that I didn't pay more than I did for it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kopet

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Value in 2015!
customer_reviews.text: For the price the Nexus 6 is going for on Amazon now, you can't beat this device! Coming from a 2014 Moto X that is always advertised as being as close to "stock Android" as you can get, I can tell you there's no substitute for real Stock Android! Running the latest Android 6.0 Marshmallow, the Nexus 6 is as smooth and fast as any smart phone I've ever seen. In comparison to the newest Droid Turbo 2, it is still much smoother. I've yet to see the new Nexus 6p in person, but for the price difference, I'm in no rush to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really a no brainer
customer_reviews.text: So far has been the best Android I've owned to date. At first the size seems overwhelming but you get uses to itbvwry quick. Once you do it seems impossible to go back to using anything less in size. The front facing speakers are awesome. Those alone make the phone top notch, and that's not even getting into how responsive and quick the device is. Well worth the money glad I waited for them to drop in price.
customer_reviews.author: Calaeb H.

customer_reviews.title: Super Smart Phone, dependable, reliable Quality feel
customer_reviews.text: State of the Art! Manufactured under Google specification with no performance or memory hogging "Bloatware" from manufacturer (Motorola) nor from your service provider! The display is soo big, you will rarely use a tablet, as you can read Web articles with a LOT of screen content before scrolling. Google specification with manufacturer Motorola combined for a "Home-Run" on the Nexus 6.
customer_reviews.author: DanTheMan

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!!!
customer_reviews.text: Straight up junk from the first week!! This thing freezes up non stop!!!!!!! God forbid you need this phone in a life or death situation.i have had this phone freeze and lock up.and I had to wait for the battery to run out so I could reboot it. Honestly this is the worst phone I have ever bought.and it's not cheap..i wasted all that money.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone!
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale, and so far I absolutely love the phone. There are a few knocks on it like it heating up if you are using it on something quite demanding, but that is to be expected. I really enjoy the size of the phone, and just the feel of it in my hand. This phone is definitely not a one hand user phone. You'll have to use both of your hands to operate it without the risk of dropping it. My biggest annoyance is how easy it is to turn on and off the phone. The button is so sensitive, but so far that has been my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Lee

customer_reviews.title: Buy a case! Replacing the screen is the same price as the phone.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone for the price. Beautiful screen that is very large but a good kind of large. It has the all the coolest features like turbo and wireless charging. Build quality and thinness are amazing and the curved back is comfortable to hold. Recently cracked my screen so my phone is no longer waterproof and most companies are charging 150+ to replace it. The camera is amazing too and shoots beautiful video but under performs in low light. My only problem is with the battery, I tend to get 4 hours on time with it and less when I use more intense apps.
customer_reviews.author: Abrahim Baluch

customer_reviews.title: i went from note 4 to this phone and love it, nothing beats stock android in terms of ...
customer_reviews.text: i went from note 4 to this phone and love it, nothing beats stock android in terms of user experience. my only real gripe about this phone is the battery life. for such a large phone, it should have a better battery life than it does; the note 4 certainly sets the standard in that regard. also, some chargers/usb cables will not work work with this phone; you will see the charging icon on the top right, but your phone will not actually charge! this was the case when using my note 4 charger, but i haven't had any issues using the quick charger than came with the nexus 6.
customer_reviews.author: Yvan

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of your hexes and pick up a nexus
customer_reviews.text: So incredibly glad I got this phone. No more bloatware and limitations imposed by my carrier. Significantly faster than my previous phone which was newer and supposedly a more feature-rich phone and a "flagship" phone. Glad I got the larger capacity too. Looking forward to a similar phone with a finger print sensor and updated hardware in the future. Until then, I'll be loving this phone. As much as one could love a machine/inanimate object anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It's a great phone, I love the 2K AMOLED screen
customer_reviews.text: Bought it from an Amazon Warehouse deal; phone came brand new for $200 with only damage to the box. It's a great phone, I love the 2K AMOLED screen. Due to the way the edges are, be careful if you are going to use a tempered glass screen protector, mine did the "holo effect" and has a small air pocket all the way around the screen. For those looking for a suggested ROM, I am using the newest CM13 nightly and it works a treat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conners

customer_reviews.title: Good phone but should wait for sale
customer_reviews.text: Very nice phone, though it can get very hot easily after playing a game for about 15 minutes it can drain your phone's battery down about 4 percent.But that's really the only con, I can easily get a whole day with about 30 percent left, with heavy usage. Good camera for social media etc. I'm getting good 4G LTE speed with T-Mobile from California. Overall this is a very good phone and has a good battery, a good camera, good signal from the big companies such as T-Mobile Verizon atnt and sprint. Also do not fear of the big screen I got used to it in about 2 days and this is me coming from a 4.7 inch screen
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: opening and playing games like Asphalt 8 Airborne
customer_reviews.text: The speed of opening websites, opening and playing games like Asphalt 8 Airborne, downloading (apps, songs, and videos is awesome. The dual LED flashlights creates envy. Soccer this phone is old, accessories for it are pretty cheap. But this phone is terribly hard to see on a sunny day outside. This phone's speed surprised the T-Mobile sales Rep! I used there slowest Wi-Fi and he still was amazed! Oh, I did not see any cosmetic damage on screen nor body.
customer_reviews.author: AndreDP

customer_reviews.title: this phone is not compatible with the Verizon network
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone because it was supposed to be compatible with Verizon. I received it today and took it to my Verizon store to have it activated and was told by the store and the customer service department at the Verizon headquarters that it is not compatible with them. I am returning it to the dealer. I am very disatisfied with this dealer.
customer_reviews.author: tammi baldwin

customer_reviews.title: WAO!
customer_reviews.text: WAO! This is the best phone I've gotten so far. I've an iPhone user for some time now, but needed an android phone for the google services at my work and well I gave it a try and it's been quite smooth. Only have used it for 1 day but it's extremely easy to use. Only issue is that it get a little hot when using it over more than 10 minutes straight but is not discomforting. Give 5 stars as the design fits all my needs and I got android M upgrade right away.
customer_reviews.author: Mariano

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Phone.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: It is a bigger phone then I am used to, but now it has been a couple of weeks and I am ok with it. The first day there were about 10 updates on the device to Android Marshmallow. Pros: The screen, sound(speakers), camera, and overall speed of the device is amazing. The battery is better then expected after reading other reviews. I get a full day and then some(streaming music, checking FB, Instagram etc.) The call quality is awesome using on Metro PCS in NYC. I would recommend this phone See Below. .I took this photo with it's awesome camera
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Used Nexus 6 Model XT1103 doesnt break the bank!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous that I would get an international version after reading some of the reviews. Luckily MobileSpree did send a Model XT1103 that worked flawlessly with LTE. The phone functioned 100% as promised. And it came with 6.0.1 Marshmallow! There were no major scratches on the screen (had to look really really hard to see any!). Slight wear near the charge port. Back case had light scuffs. I put a screen protector & case on it so my phone looks good as new! Awesome deal especially if you are happier saving $$$ instead of spending a small fortune on a phone. Next time I need to buy a used phone, I'm definitely going to check MobileSpree's inventory first!
customer_reviews.author: Jerzeecanuck

customer_reviews.title: The best phone I've had to date!
customer_reviews.text: The Nexus 6 is a great phone. I purchased this to replace my HTC One Max on Verizon. Needed a different size SIM card, but the Verizon store was very helpful to provide me with one. The fact that it runs stock Android is one of the main reasons I ordered this device. It is updated far more frequently than my previous devices and doesn't have near as much (if any) bloatware. The preloaded apps can all be removed without too much trouble. Google also provides factory images that can be flashed to upgrade/reset the device in addition to over the air updates.
customer_reviews.author: Man0f5tee1e

customer_reviews.title: As great as it is big
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my iPad and shattered the screen. Meanwhile my iPhone 4 was getting long in the tooth. I decided to get a big phone and try to live with one device. Two months in I'm saying it was a genius move. Big in the pocket sure, but big when it comes to web surfing, email, buying stuff on Amazon, etc. Super great as a GPS unit when I travel. Holy cow! Love, love, love this device.
customer_reviews.author: Arky Pete

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone if you don't use your camera.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great phone overall, but the camera is one of the weak points. The first few days were ok, but after that, the camera had problems focusing and adjusting to light. Even after resetting the phone to default, the same issues were happening indicating it was more of a hardware issue than a setting that was changed. However, if you need an awesome phone that has a sweet looking screen, you can't go wrong with this now given how much the price has dropped since new, its a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: It would be a good phone, except the battery suuucks
customer_reviews.text: It would be a good phone, except the battery suuucks! Bought it brand new, and after 3 months, the phone crashes when trying to run anything graphic intensive. Have to keep it constantly plugged in to be able to use it. I never had this problem with my Nexus 5 made by LG. From now on I will never buy a Motorola phone again, only LG from for the rest of my life. To anyone looking at this phone go with a the comparable LG phone.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Unlocked so you can dump your carrier if they get too expensive or in my case had poor coverage where I needed the phone to func
customer_reviews.text: New phone, discontinued at half the going price when it was new. Unlocked so you can dump your carrier if they get too expensive or in my case had poor coverage where I needed the phone to function 100%. Left VM and bought this phone and now use AT&T.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle James

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone and will have a hard time replacing ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone and will have a hard time replacing it when the time comes unless we get another Nexus with a 6" screen. I can't imagine trying to use a phone with a smaller screen after owning this. Had a problem with the volume down button becoming increasingly hard to press after about 6 months, so sent it for a replacement and got a New/refurbished one quickly. Would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great phone - would be better if it were slightly smaller
customer_reviews.text: I obtained this phone used. However, it's still in great shape. The display is crisp. I love that it's always kept up to date on the latest release of Android. The battery life is good. I can usually get a full day out of it. The camera seems to produce high quality photos. The only thing that I don't like about it is the size. It's barely small enough to fit in the breast pocket of my shirts.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wilkin

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone with negligible flaws
customer_reviews.text: Great Phone with very few flaws Pros: 1) Pure Android Experience 2) 5.9 Inch Screen: Simpy Great Screen, Wide Viewing Angles 3) Snappy Processor while switching between Apps 4) Great Battery Life if you disable Motorola Ambient Display 5) Cons: 1) Screen little dim under sun 2) Experienced low sound from ear piece (sound) but speakerphone is loud. May be my phone or everyone experience i'm not sure 3) Screen Size may be little big for few people.For me it is perfect. 4) Phone Gets hot while charging with Turbo Charger (the charger it comes with) heard it is expected. i use normal charger.
customer_reviews.author: lakshman prasad vasam

customer_reviews.title: Love this huge Nexus 6 with marshmallow.  :)
customer_reviews.text: As being Sammy fan with touchwiz i was little skeptical about pure android. But noticed this giant phone is so snappy, No lag at all. I had a DOA with first one but then amazon replaced so quickly. Got a marshmallow update right away, This thing is huge. I liked blue one better than white but again its a personal preference.No CON so far. Overall with my first nexus device pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Sam Adams

customer_reviews.title: In summary I have a very good device, but it is obsolete if it can ...
customer_reviews.text: In the description it says that it has android operating system 5.2 with option to updates, the system downloads the update but does not install it, giving the error security failure. I have rebooted the system, I have set it to factory values ​​and the problem is not solved. In summary I have a very good device, but it is obsolete if it can not be updated. Very disappointing. !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Veliz

customer_reviews.title: Was not happy with the charger it stopped working after 6months
customer_reviews.text: Was not happy with the charger it stopped working after 6months. The charger pin point had a broken pin or it broke while connecting, I had to send for repair.they did the service however they removed the screen guard and never put it back or give me any reimbursement.
customer_reviews.author: heena

customer_reviews.title: Yellow, Yellow, Dirty fellow
customer_reviews.text: You must know by now that this is a great device. It is zippy and fast but still it is an example of a Nexus device lacking few key features. 1) Quality Control - The screen is yellow. Some call it a warm screen but this one is too dull and too yellow. 2) Battery Drain - I have not installed many apps and have not even put a sim inside. It updated to marshmallow but still there is battery drain, battery drains in a day. 3) Heating issue - Earlier phones used to heat under heavy activity but this one heats even for casual browsing.
customer_reviews.author: Hima

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a premium device.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could root and dev with Google vanilla OS. So far so good, boot loader has been unlocked was rooted briefly but now I'm on Android N Preview 2. Phone is my daily but I have its successor the Nexus 6P. Also a great phone.The nexus 6 is a tad bulky but it fits good in my oversized hands. I wish it more RAM & gigabyte space but still a very good phone in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: The nexus 6 is one of the worst phones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: The nexus 6 is one of the worst phones I've ever had. As the battery drains, the performance deteriorates significantly which makes opening and using apps very tedious because of the lag and delay. Snapchat is virtually impossible to use when the battery is below 95% charged. Unacceptable. I have since upgraded to another phone. I would recommend not purchasing this phone. The company I purchased it from was good though, and the phone came in acceptable condition, it's just that this model of phone is horrendous and I did not do the proper research beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to use on Google's Project Fi. It is a large phone but an excellent one. It took about 5 minutes to get used to the the size. I bought a 64GB for myself and we both agree it they are great phones. The sale price was the deciding factor and its ships free with prime. We just got our Fi invites last week and will be switching over from Verizon to Fi this coming week as soon as the new sims arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Great phone for the price.  Love the larger size.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, does everything I want, no issues to date. Seems well built/sturdy - I personally like the larger size. Battery lasts a couple days for me with normal use. Fast charger is great - usually I get it on the charger with around 4-10% left and it's back to 70% within 15-20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great phablet!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast phone, screen resolution is quad HD and it looks awesome, good battery life not great for the size but it has wireless charging and rapid charge. It's a big phone but the feel in hand is very good, it feels smaller but slippery so I recommend a case. I bought the Spigen Ultra Hybrid, its cristal clear on the back with gray edge and it looks great. The best of all is stock Android. If you are looking for a phablet at a great price this is hands down the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: and its on track to replace my old Samsung Note 3 as my favorite phone of all time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for over a month, and its on track to replace my old Samsung Note 3 as my favorite phone of all time. Pros: + Super fast and snappy. NO LAG. + Great signal all over the place + Unlockable, root-able, quick Android updates from Google (great for devs and Android hackers) + Front-facing speakers will change the way to buy phones from here on out Cons: - No SD card slow. C'mon Motorola/Google! - It's huge; it's like holding a TV screen - MicroUSB port is very temperamental and tough to get plugged into
customer_reviews.author: R. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Phone is fast with a beautiful screen and good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Phone is fast with a beautiful screen and good battery life. I have very large hands, and this phone is on the upper limit of comfortable phone size, so your mileage may vary, but this has replaced my Samsung Galaxy, my tablet, and most of the functions of my laptop in one device. It is a little awkward to hold during phone calls, but I've had it for two days so I'm sure I will get used to it. The latest android seems faster, smoother, and more bug-free than my last phone. TLDR: it's a really big phone, if that's what you want, you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Barry-Garland

customer_reviews.title: well packaged and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Fast Delivery, well packaged and easy to set up. Much faster and easier to use than the I-Phone 4 I replaced. Still learning the endless feature of this phone. Next up, is getting a Qi Wireless charger with speakers.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Being a 6" phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Being a 6" phone, it's almost a tablet. It's comfortable to use with two hands, but even with my large hands I find it difficult to use it with just one. Still, the screen's beautiful, and everything runs very well. Battery life is also good, as I've no issues getting through a full day on one charge. I listen to music all day at work, and read books on it on my breaks, but I've always got around 60% battery left when my work day ends. That's pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Warren M

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: Personally I like the larger "phablet" sizing. The screen is very sharp, the performance of Android "Marshmallow" on this phone is very snappy, and the battery seems to last an above average amount of time and also charges quickly with the included 15 watt charger. I'm using Google Fi service, so I know I'll be saving a few bucks over time. If you like the Android OS and the size of this phone (it will not fit into my pants pockets), you will like this phone. My wife, for example, will never use this phone because she prefers Apple's IOS.
customer_reviews.author: W. Prince

customer_reviews.title: I love Moto phones and have three
customer_reviews.text: I love Moto phones and have three. This Nexus 6 is not as responsive as the Moto G. Perhaps I received a defective one. . The screen size is perfect for me. I prefer big phones as I'm less likely to lose them. It has become more responsive as I have learned to use it. Probably will get a Galaxy s6 next tine around. After using this for a bit longer, I'm happy with it. I have a dead Samsung S6 which I also liked, but it does not like moisture..
customer_reviews.author: Secreto

customer_reviews.title: My Nexus 5 had issues and I refuse to pay ...
customer_reviews.text: My Nexus 5 had issues and I refuse to pay top $$ for the newest phone out there. They are $500+.. I just went for the Nexus 6 for 300$ and that's cheaper now than when I bought NEx5 5 years ago for 350. It's bigger, faster and twice the RAM. It was NOT the same Chip size but was was just 5 bus from ATT.
customer_reviews.author: Fred jones

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got the US model, which is what I wanted to use on T-Mobile US. Phone was delivered next day. Started to receive updates once it hit the internet. 5.1.1 plus some other updates. Works nicely. Not the best browser experience. Smoother on iOS. Great phone for the price. Band 12 LTE for T-Mobile definitely seems to make a difference vs iPhone 6 Plus with Band 12 support. Battery life seems not so good, but that might be due to the very high res display. All in all, a great buy for the price and nice to not have typical Android bloat from Samsung or HTC.
customer_reviews.author: P C

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery and Warranty void
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone from telecom wireless and it was advertised as coming with a warranty. Soon after buying it I realized it was defective. If I try to take a picture or use Google maps and the battery is not at least 70% charged the phone turns off. If I'm only using it to text the battery will last up to 10 hours. Telecom Wireless's customer support page directs you to call Motorola, so I did. They said the warranty is not valid because the phone was sold by a third party. I have sent Telecom a few e-mails but have received no answer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Been using it since January,2016, this phone is very easy to use, always gets the newest updates the quickest. It feels big at first but after few month when you get use to it, it makes any smaller screen difficult to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Gugg

customer_reviews.title: Only perfect
customer_reviews.text: You don't hear much about the Nexus 6 phone, because it works too well. Google should have stayed with Motorola, for the 6P successor product, which has been bug-ridden. Although the Nexus 6 is no longer "supported" by Google, there is continuing interest by independent developers, who offer custom ROM's based upon the latest Android versions. If you are comfortable with flashing ROM's, this "older" model is hard to beat ( f you can still find one).
customer_reviews.author: Larry L

customer_reviews.title: pretty good design
customer_reviews.text: back to android again after 4 years iPhone using, pretty good design, excellent performance,rear camera is good, I like the feature of full camera screen; naturally support FLAC audio format which is amazing; 6 inches screen is awesome; wireless charging looks doesn't work, tried two wireless charger /u green and anker, neither of them works on this device. battery life is reasonable. high possibilities of dropping off from your hand, should be very careful when you hold the device, better to have a protect case. based on the price it's absolutely a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sang Yu

customer_reviews.title: Still an amazing phone!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing phone for $250. I wanted to get the nexus 6P but to be honest the nexus 6 still does an amazing job. Compare to the price of the 6P, this is a better deal. Fast charging, wireless charging, great speed, amazing display, latest OS marshmallow 6.0.1 and an ok camera, you can't go wrong with this phone. I guess the biggest con is the cameras, rear is OK but the front is just awful.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: to make matters worst contacted amazon about it
customer_reviews.text: bought the phone as "new"... have been using it for around two weeks... battery drains faster everytime...using the same applications, to make matters worst contacted amazon about it... they pretty much tell me it wasn't their problem...on top of that, just realized the phone is not Android certified... and I bought a "nexus".... I feel am I am being let down on this one specially since the order is "fullfilled by amazon" whatever that means... I am just very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: nelcamq

customer_reviews.title: Phone keeps shutting down and factory re-setting for no reason ...
customer_reviews.text: Phone keeps shutting down and factory re-setting for no reason, sometimes in the middle of the night. It is defective as others have commented the same. It is only 3 months old and was purchased brand new. I have not dropped the phone or otherwise done anything that could cause such a thing. I want my $ back!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate phablet for those who love phablets
customer_reviews.text: For those who can handle the massive 6" screen size, this is the best phone you can get for the money. Forget about all of the cons that others might point out, the biggest plus is that this is a Nexus phone, so Google directly supports it. Marshmallow was available the day that Google released it, and unlike other OEM phones, has no carrier or OEM bloatware. Just pure Android, updated faster than any other phones outside of the Nexus line.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love that I was able to get a new phone (albeit a few years old) for under $200. I needed it as a replacement for the exact same model and it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone that I got for a great price during ...
customer_reviews.text: Great phone that I got for a great price during the 2015 Black Friday sale. I used it for a few months before moving onto the Moto X Pure. The Nexus 6 was just a tad big for me but otherwise worked wonderfully and I liked that it had band 12 for T-Mobile.
customer_reviews.author: J.E.

customer_reviews.title: Remember to get a NANO sized SIM card when you buy this
customer_reviews.text: I've had the phone for a couple of days now and I'm super impressed. The screen makes reading way more pleasurable than on my Nexus 5 (5 inch screen) and the battery life is phenomenal. The battery had over 30% remaining after a full day of active use on the weekend, with the screen at full brightness and a live wallpaper running in the background all the time. Also, I love that the screen activate when you pick the phone up, which was a great, unexpected feature.
customer_reviews.author: Ken The Movie Guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Motorola device
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this cell after breaking my note4. I am very impressed by the stock Android experience. Very easy to setup with Verizon and instantly updated to 7.0 Android N. Only con is the battery life. If you are like me a heavy cell user you can expect 5 hours of use before a quick charge.
customer_reviews.author: andrew gormish

customer_reviews.title: Junk phone stay away from it.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this phone. Bought two of them. The phones are always closing the apps. Battery life is only 2to4 hours at best. One of the phones shuts off everytime you answer a text message or phone call. VERRY annoying! Also the bottom curvature makes the phone hard to grip.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: I like the big screen which makes it very comfortable to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Nexus phones and Motorola Nexus 6 is the nicest one I have had so far. I like the big screen which makes it very comfortable to watch videos and TVs. The camera can use a bit more improvement but it is still better than the LG I had last. I hardly had any problem with the phone since I have been using it for a few months. It never dies or freezes on me. It is quite easy to hold it with my hand as well.
customer_reviews.author: H.B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Damn good phone.
customer_reviews.text: Love my phone. Only wish it had the "tap the screen to turn on screen" feature like my LG G3 did. Other then that, its super fast, takes awesome pictures, and no bloatware. Plus I got it for $199.
customer_reviews.author: Ever

customer_reviews.title: Average Phone Overall
customer_reviews.text: Not the best top-of-the-line phone but good for the price. Dull display, bulky setup, average battery life, slow system. I would prefer a lower tier Samsung phones instead.
customer_reviews.author: T H

customer_reviews.title: This phone is awesome, huge
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long. This phone is awesome, huge, but awesome. Big step up from my galaxy S5. Camera was a step sideways or maybe down. But nexus gets you into Project Fi so this is a cheap way to get started. The screen is awesome, camera is ok, speed is phenomenal, and stock Android is where it's at. I've had iPhones, flip phones, Samsung smart phones and this. This is my favorite. I may skip the Nexus 6p.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great all around device
customer_reviews.text: This is truly an amazing phone. The expansive screen is ideal for gaming, media consumption and reading. While the size was initially off-putting, I got used to the phone within a week or so. Now even the Nexus 5 I used to use seems small and cramped. Build quality is excellent and it feels good in the hand. Call quality is also well above average and the camera is adequate. All in all, an excellent all around device.
customer_reviews.author: betazed

customer_reviews.title: This Phone Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this phone for about 4 weeks and I have to write to say that I love this phone completely. It is BIG and I love the front facing stereo speakers. I have cell service from GoSmart, which has limited range compared to AT&T, but is much cheaper. I'm coming from a Galaxy S4 and a OnePlus One. This Nexus 6 beats the S4 hands down, of course, and it is better than the OnePlus One. I would buy this phone again.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone for Google's ProjectFi
customer_reviews.text: Awesome battery life and very fast phone. It is quite large but because the back is curved it still fits nicely in my pocket and doesn't feel any bigger than my previous OnePlus One. I use it with Google's ProjectFi and so far it has good signal strength and is a good all around phone. Camera takes comparable pictures to the OnePlus One but seems to focus faster and has a better time in low light conditions in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hess

product_meta.title: Motorola Nexus 6 GSM Unlocked Smartphone, 32GB, 6" Screen, Dual Front-facing Stereo Speakers - Cloud White (International Version)
product_meta.description: Color:Cloud White| Size:32 GBStunning 6-inch Quad HD display is great for movies, videos, gaming, e-books, and surfing the web, with round-the-clock battery life. It includes Phone, Charger and Quick Guides. Compatible with Google Project Fi wireless network (Google invite required), see details at https://fi.google.com/about/faq/
feature_bullets: More space to explore - A bigger phone with more everything
Brilliant 6" screen and dual front-facing stereo speakers make content shine
Go longer and charge less with 3220 mash battery which provides up to 24 hours per charge and turbo charging.
Get the most out of Android 5.0 Lollipop (compatible with Android Marshmallow 6.0)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars3,644 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Touchscreen, Built-in-gps, Bluetooth-enabled, Dual-camera, Lte, Smartphone
specifications.Included Components: 1-Lithium Ion Battery, Quick Guides, Charger, Motorola Nexus 6 Unlocked Cellphone, 32Gb, Cloud White
